text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus, the Christ, Son of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: as it is written in the prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord; make his paths straight.
speaker: Narrator

text: John baptized in the wilderness and preached the baptism of repentance for remission of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea and those of Jerusalem and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: John was clothed with camel’s hair and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he ate locusts and wild honey
speaker: Narrator

text: and preached, saying, There comes one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
speaker: Narrator

text: I indeed have baptized you with water, but he shall baptize you with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass in those days that Jesus came from Nazareth a city of Galilee and was baptized of John in the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as he was come out of the water, John saw the heavens opened and the Spirit like a dove descending and resting upon him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there came a voice from heaven, saying, Thou art my dear Son, in whom I delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately the Spirit drove him into the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days and forty nights and was tempted of Satan and was with the wild beasts, and the angels ministered unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent ye and believe the gospel.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea, for they were fishers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
speaker: Jesus

text: And straightway they forsook their nets and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had gone a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And straightway he called them; and leaving their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, they went after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they entered into Capernaum, and straightway on the sabbath days he entered into the synagogue and taught.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they marvelled at his learning, for he taught them as one that had power with him, and not as the scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, Let us alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? Art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Be silent, and come out of him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And the unclean spirit tore him and cried with a loud voice and came out of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? What new doctrine is this? for he commands the unclean spirits with power, and they obey him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Simon’s mother-in-law lay sick of a fever, and soon they told him of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came and took her by the hand and lifted her up; and the fever left her by and by, and she ministered unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the evening, when the sun was down, they brought unto him all that were diseased and those that were possessed with devils.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the city was gathered together at the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he healed many that were sick of diverse diseases and cast out many devils and suffered not the devils to speak because they knew him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out and departed into a solitary place and prayed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simon and those that were with him followed after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had found him, they said unto him, All men seek for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns that I may preach there also, for truly I came forth for that purpose.
speaker: Jesus

text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee and cast out devils.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a leper came to him, beseeching him and kneeling down to him and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, having mercy on him, put forth his hand and touched him and said unto him, I will; be thou clean.
speaker: Jesus

text: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was clean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he straitly charged him and forthwith sent him away
speaker: Narrator

text: and said unto him, See thou say nothing to any man, but go, show thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
speaker: Jesus

text: But he went out and began to publish it much and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places; and they came to him from every quarter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again he entered into Capernaum after some days, and it was heard that he was in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And soon many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive them, no, not so much as about the door; and he preached the word unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came unto him, bringing a paralytic, carried by four men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they could not come near unto him for the crowd, they uncovered the roof of the house where he was; and when they had broken it open, they let down the bed in which the paralytic lay.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the paralytic, Son, thy sins are forgiven thee.
speaker: Jesus

text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there and thinking in their hearts,
speaker: Narrator

text: Why does this fellow so blaspheme? Who can forgive sins but God only?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, knowing afterward in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said unto them, Why think ye these things in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: What is easier to say to the paralytic, Thy sins are forgiven thee, or to say, Arise and take up thy bed and walk?
speaker: Jesus

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man has power on earth to forgive sins (he spoke to the sick of the palsy),
speaker: Jesus

text: I say unto thee, Arise and take up thy bed and go to thy house.
speaker: Jesus

text: And by and by he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, We never saw anything like unto this.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went again unto the sea; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom and said unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And it came to pass, that as Jesus sat at the table in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also at the table together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many and they had followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scribes and Pharisees, seeing him eat with publicans and sinners, said unto his disciples, How is it that he eats and drinks with publicans and sinners?
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard it, he said unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick; I came not to call the righteous, but the sinners to repentance.
speaker: Jesus

text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees did fast and therefore came and said unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said unto them, Can those who are in a wedding fast while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the days will come when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then they shall fast in those days.
speaker: Jesus

text: No one mends an old garment with a new piece of cloth, or else the new piece that filled it up tears away from the old, and the rent is made worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins; or else the new wine bursts the wineskins, and the wine is spilled, and the wineskins are lost; but new wine must be poured into new wineskins.
speaker: Jesus

text: And it came to pass that as he went through the planted fields again on the sabbath day, his disciples began, as they walked, to pluck the ears of grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Have ye never read what David did when he had need and was hungry, he and those that were with him?
speaker: Jesus

text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest and ate the showbread, which is not lawful to eat but for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?
speaker: Jesus

text: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath;
speaker: Jesus

text: therefore the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath.
speaker: Jesus

text: And he entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had a withered hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day, that they might accuse him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he said unto the man who had the withered hand, Stand forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days or to do evil? to save the person or to kill them? But they were silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And looking round about on them with anger, being grieved for the blindness of their hearts, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it out and his hand was restored whole as the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as the Pharisees went forth, they took counsel with the Herodians against him, to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea, and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Jerusalem and from Idumaea and from beyond Jordan. And those who dwell around Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spoke to his disciples that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he had healed many, insomuch that as many as had plagues pressed upon him to touch him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him and cried out, saying, Thou art the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went up to the mountain and called unto himself whom he would, and they came unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he established twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach
speaker: Narrator

text: and to have power to heal sicknesses and to cast out devils:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon, whom he gave the name Peter;
speaker: Narrator

text: and James the son of Zebedee and John the brother of James, whom he surnamed them Boanerges, which is The sons of thunder;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Andrew and Philip and Bartholomew and Matthew and Thomas and James the son of Alphaeus and Thaddaeus and Simon the Canaanite
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him; and they came home.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when his friends and family heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him; for they said, He is beside himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the scribes who had come down from Jerusalem said that he had Beelzebub and that by the prince of the devils he cast out devils.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called them unto him and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?
speaker: Narrator

text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if Satan rises up against himself and is divided, he cannot remain, but has an end.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man can enter into a strong man’s house and spoil his goods except he will first bind the strong man, and then he will spoil his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men and whatever blasphemies with which they shall blaspheme,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whosoever shall blaspheme against the Holy Spirit shall never have forgiveness but is obligated to eternal judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they said, He has an unclean spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The multitude was sitting all around him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brothers and sisters seek thee without.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother or my brethren?
speaker: Narrator

text: And looking round about on those who sat about him, he said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
speaker: Narrator

text: For whosoever doeth the will of God, the same is my brother and my sister and my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began again to teach by the sea side, and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship and sat in the sea, and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he taught them many things by parables and said unto them in his doctrine,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken; Behold, the sower went out to sow;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it came to pass as he sowed some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some fell on stony ground where it had not much earth, and immediately it sprang up because it had no depth of earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: but when the sun was up, it was scorched, and because it had no root, it withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And other fell on good ground and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased and brought forth: some thirty and some sixty and some a hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, He that has ears to hear, let him hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he was alone, those that were close to him with the twelve asked of him the parable.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God; but unto those that are without, all these things are done in parables,
speaker: Narrator

text: that seeing they may see and not perceive, and hearing they may hear and not understand, lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? How then will ye understand all the parables?
speaker: Narrator

text: The sower is he who sows the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are those by the way side, in whom the word is sown, but when they have heard, Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise these are those who are sown on stony ground, who when they have heard the word immediately receive it with gladness
speaker: Narrator

text: but have no root in themselves and are temporal; afterward, when tribulation or persecution arises for the word’s sake, immediately they are offended.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are those who are sown among thorns, such as hear the word,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are those who are sown in good ground, such as hear the word and receive it and bring forth fruit: some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some a hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he also said unto them, Is the lamp brought to be put under the bushel or under the bed? and not to be set in the lampstand?
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is nothing hid which shall not be manifested; nor secret which shall not be exposed.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he also said unto them, Take heed what ye hear; with the measure ye measure by, ye shall be measured by others, and unto you that hear shall more be added.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that has, to him shall be given; and he that has not, from him shall be taken even that which he has.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground
speaker: Narrator

text: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring forth and grow up, he knows not how.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the earth brings forth fruit of herself: first the blade, then the ear, after that the full grain in the ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he puts in the sickle because the harvest is come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also said, Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? Or with what parable shall we compare it?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that are in the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: but when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all herbs and shoots out great branches, so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with many such parables he spoke the word unto them as they were able to hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But without a parable he did not speak unto them; and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that same day, when evening was come, he said unto them, Let us pass over unto the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow; and they awoke him and said unto him, Master, dost thou not care that we perish?
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he arose, he rebuked the wind and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? How is it that ye have no faith?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they feared exceedingly and said one to another, Who is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him a man of the tombs, with an unclean spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had his dwelling among the tombs; and no one could bind him, no, not with chains,
speaker: Narrator

text: because many times he had been bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been broken in pieces by him, and the fetters shattered; neither could anyone tame him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains and in the tombs, crying out and hurting himself with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Crying out with a loud voice, he said, What hast thou with me, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he said unto him, Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked him, What is thy name? And he answered, saying, My name is Legion, for we are many.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he besought him much that he would not send him away out of that country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now near unto the mountains there was a great herd of swine feeding,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all those devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out and entered into the swine, and the herd fell over a cliff into the sea (they were about two thousand) and were choked in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those that fed the swine fled and told it in the city and in the country. And people went out to see what it was that had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they come to Jesus and see him that was tormented by the demon and had the legion sitting and clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those that saw it told them what happened to him that had the demon and also concerning the swine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to plead with him to depart out of their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he was entering into the ship, he that had been troubled by the demon besought him that he might be with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus suffered him not but said unto him, Go home to thy friends and family and tell them what great things the Lord has done with thee and how he has had mercy on thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went and began to publish in Decapolis what great things Jesus had done with him, and everyone marveled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, a great multitude gathered unto him, and he was near the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of the princes of the synagogue came, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet
speaker: Narrator

text: and besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lies at the point of death; come and lay thy hands on her that she may be saved, and she shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus went with him; and a great multitude followed him and thronged him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain woman, who had an issue of blood twelve years
speaker: Narrator

text: and had suffered many things of many physicians and had spent all that she had and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse;
speaker: Narrator

text: when she had heard of Jesus, came from behind among the multitude and touched his garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned to the crowd and said, Who touched my clothes?
speaker: Narrator

text: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee and sayest thou, Who touched me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him and told him all the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith has made thee saved; go in peace and remain whole of thy plague.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he yet spoke, there came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house certain who said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he said unto the prince of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he suffered no one to follow him, except Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to the house of the prince of the synagogue and saw the tumult and those that wept and wailed greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he was come in, he said unto them, Why make ye this ado and weep? The damsel is not dead, but sleeps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he took the father and the mother of the damsel and those that were with him and entered in where the damsel was lying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And taking the damsel by the hand, he said unto her, Talitha cumi, which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, arise.
speaker: Narrator

text: And straightway the damsel arose and walked, for she was twelve years old. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he charged them straitly that no one should know it and commanded that something should be given her to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out from there and came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue; and many hearing him were astonished, saying, From where has this man these things? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him and such mighty works that are wrought by his hands?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James and Joses and of Juda and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not dishonoured except in his own country and among his own kin and in his own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he could do no mighty work there except that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk and healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went through the villages round about, teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called unto him the twelve and began to send them forth by two and two and gave them power over the unclean spirits
speaker: Narrator

text: and commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey except a staff only: no provision bag, no bread, no money in their purse;
speaker: Narrator

text: but be shod with sandals and not put on two coats.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, In whatever place ye enter into a house, there abide until ye depart from that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whosoever shall not receive you nor hear you, when ye depart from there, shake off the dust under your feet in testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment than for that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went out and preached that men should repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cast out many demons and anointed with oil many that were sick, and they were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And king Herod heard of him (for his name was spread abroad), and he said, John the Baptist has risen from the dead, and therefore virtues operate in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Others said, It is Elijah. And others said, It is the prophet or one of the prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod heard of it, he said, This is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John and bound him in prison for Herodias’ sake, his brother Philip’s wife, for he had married her.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him and would have killed him, but she could not;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just and holy man, and respected him; and when he heard him, he did many things and heard him gladly.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they accuse thee of.

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: For he knew that the princes of the priests had delivered him for envy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the princes of the priests moved the multitude that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate answered and said again unto them, What will ye then that I shall do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cried out again, crucify him. {Gr. stauroo – Hang him on a stake}
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil has he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, crucify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers led him away into the hall called Praetorium, and they call together the whole band.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they clothed him with purple and platted a crown of thorns and put it about his head
speaker: Narrator

text: and began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!
speaker: Narrator

text: And they smote him on the head with a reed and spit upon him and bowing their knees worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him and put his own clothes on him and led him out to crucify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they compel one Simon, a Cyrenian, who passed by coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross. {Gr. stauros – stake}
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought him unto the place of Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh, but he received it not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was the third hour when they crucified him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the inscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with him they crucified two thieves: the one on his right hand and the other on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scripture was fulfilled, which says, And he was numbered with the transgressors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads and saying, Ah, thou that would destroy the temple of God and build it in three days,
speaker: Narrator

text: save thyself and come down from the cross. {Gr. stauros – stake}
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also the princes of the priests mocking said among themselves with the scribes, He saved others; himself he cannot save.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the Christ, King of Israel, descend now from the stake that we may see and believe. And those that were crucified {Gr. Stauroo – to hang on a stake} with him reviled him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
speaker: Narrator

text: And some of those that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calls Elijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And one ran and filled a sponge full of vinegar and put it on a reed and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see whether Elijah will come to take him down.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, giving a great cry, expired.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the centurion, who stood in front of him, saw that he so cried out and expired, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were also some women looking on afar off, among whom was Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James the lesser and of Joses, and Salome
speaker: Narrator

text: (who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him and ministered unto him), and many other women who came up with him unto Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now when the evening was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph of Arimathaea, a noble senator, who also waited for the kingdom of God, came and went in boldly unto Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate marvelled that he was already dead; and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he was already dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he bought fine linen and took him down and wrapped him in the linen and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sabbath of the great feast of the passover was past, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James, and Salome had bought sweet spices that they might come and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And very early in the morning the first of the sabbaths, they come unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away, for it was very great.
speaker: Narrator

text: And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting to the right hand side, covered in a long white garment; and they were frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said unto them, Do not be frightened; Ye seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified; he is risen; he is not here; behold the place where they laid him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go tell his disciples and Peter that he goes before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him as he said unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went out quickly and fled from the sepulchre, for they trembled and were amazed; neither said they any thing to anyone, for they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as Jesus rose early the first of the sabbaths, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she went and told those that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, when they had heard that he was alive and had been seen of her, did not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that he appeared in another form unto two of them, as they walked and went into the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went and told it unto the others, yet they did not believe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at the table and upbraided them for their unbelief and hardness of heart because they did not believe those who had seen him after he was risen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that believes and is baptized shall be saved, but he that believes not shall be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these signs shall follow those that believe: In my name they shall cast out demons; they shall speak with new tongues;
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall take away serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands upon the sick, and they shall be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received up into heaven and sat at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, going forth, preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word with the signs which followed them. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
